thread.title: Vikings surge to wins, Lion girls downed in road games
thread.title_full: Vikings surge to wins, Lion girls downed in road games

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Vikings surge to wins, Lion girls downed in road games
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Vikings surge to wins, Lion girls downed in road games SDHS' Coffin tallies four goals, Ogden three By Staff | Oct 14, 2015 
The regular season is winding to a close, but whether Waldo County high school soccer teams are playoff-bound or looking to play late-season spoiler, all were in search of wins on the pitch on Tuesday, Oct. 13. 
The Searsport boys and girls netted road victories over Greater Portland Christian, while the Belfast girls were not as fortunate as they were blanked on the road against Winslow. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Girls soccer 
Searsport 9, Greater Portland Christian 1 
At South Portland Oct. 12, the Vikings bested the Lions by eight scores. Searsport led 5-1 at halftime. The game was halted with 10 minutes remaining due injuries and sickness to GPC players. 
Leading the Viking offense were Karigen Coffin (4 goals), Melinda Ogden (3 goals), Ashten Wells (goal, assist), Karyn Mylen (goal), Brooklynn Alberts (assist) and Anna Bucklin (assist). 
Clarissa Jones scored the lone goal for the Lions off a penalty kick. 
Alberts and Morgan Ireland combined to make two saves on three shots in goal for Searsport, while Clairette Kirezi made nine saves on 25 shots innet for GPC. The Vikings held a 6-0 edge in corner kicks. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (8-4, 47.3469 points) is fourth, while Richmond (10-1, 106.1141 points) is first in the 10-team region. The top seven teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Winslow 7, Belfast 0 
At Winslow Oct. 12, the Black Raiders blasted the visiting Lions. 
Leading the Winslow offense were Sara Doughty (2 goals), Maddy Morneault (2 goals), Desiree Veilleux (goal) and Courtney Colford (goal). 
Cori Shooter made 11 saves in goal for Belfast, while Mackenzie Labrie made five saves in net for Winslow. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (1-11, 4.8469 points) is 18th, while Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaton (11-0-1, 135.7143 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Boys soccer 
Searsport 4, Greater Portland Christian 2 
At South Portland Oct. 12, the Vikings bested the Lions en route to their eighth win. 
Connor Kneeland, Liam MacMillan, Dean Evans and Barrett Grant scored for Searsport, while Kneeland and Charlie Spiegel logged assists. 
Ryan Dyer and Killiam Patterson scored for GPC. 
Ben Powell and George Dakin combined to allow three saves on seven shots in goal for the Vikings, while Mason Jones made eight saves on 16 shots in net for the Lions. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (8-3-1, 74.7194 points) is third, while Buckfield (12-1, 107.1065 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs.
